result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $400 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.addlTxt: JOC Ret'd - Not Deliverable as Addressed - UTA

Case called @ 2:12 p.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given. Bond previously posted to be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE requesting additional time to install the IID and obtain a valid DL.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth J. Miller

Prior: 520 Thackery St., Redgranite, WI 54970
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 2:47 PM: Defendant Kenneth J. Miller in court, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def requests counsel.  Prior to deciding on counsel issue, Def would then like to speak with the State on his own on resolution without representation.  DA will be able to speak with the Def immediately following Court today. NGP entered by Court.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
